body_html:
Please send a separate PR for tf.string, I think I'm not the best person to
review that (maybe andrew selle)

On Sun, Oct 16, 2016 at 7:50 PM, Jingtian Peng notifications@github.com
wrote:

@DjangoPeng commented on this pull request.

In tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py
#4826:

  • def _get_default_initializer(self, shape=None, dtype=dtypes.float32):
  • """Use this function to provide a default and corresponding initializer of dtype
  • Args:
  •  dtype: Type of the new or existing variable.(defaults to `DT_FLOAT`).
  • Returns:
  •  initializer and initializing_from_value. See documentation of get_variable above.
  • Raises:
  •  TypeError: When giving unsupported dtype.
  • """
  • if dtype.is_floating:
  •  initializer = init_ops.uniform_unit_scaling_initializer()

  •  initializing_from_value = False
  • elif dtype.is_string:

I think tf.string is the same issue regarding initialization, so put them
in one PR. If you insist that they are different, I can split them to
reopen a PR for tf.string

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

#4826, or mute the thread

.
body_text:
Please send a separate PR for tf.string, I think I'm not the best person to
review that (maybe andrew selle)
On Sun, Oct 16, 2016 at 7:50 PM, Jingtian Peng notifications@github.com
wrote:

@DjangoPeng commented on this pull request.
In tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py
#4826:


def _get_default_initializer(self, shape=None, dtype=dtypes.float32):
"""Use this function to provide a default and corresponding initializer of dtype





Args:

 dtype: Type of the new or existing variable.(defaults to `DT_FLOAT`).





Returns:

 initializer and initializing_from_value. See documentation of get_variable above.





Raises:

 TypeError: When giving unsupported dtype.


"""
if dtype.is_floating:

 initializer = init_ops.uniform_unit_scaling_initializer()



 initializing_from_value = False


elif dtype.is_string:


I think tf.string is the same issue regarding initialization, so put them
in one PR. If you insist that they are different, I can split them to
reopen a PR for tf.string
—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#4826, or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim7-wfbJPfieTsVgHcWnFT8H8svPGks5q0uKGgaJpZM4KRMaa
.
body:
Please send a separate PR for tf.string, I think I'm not the best person to
review that (maybe andrew selle)

On Sun, Oct 16, 2016 at 7:50 PM, Jingtian Peng notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ## _@DjangoPeng_ commented on this pull request.
> 
> In tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/4826:
> 
> > -  def _get_default_initializer(self, shape=None, dtype=dtypes.float32):
> > -    """Use this function to provide a default and corresponding initializer of dtype
> >   +
> > -    Args:
> > -      dtype: Type of the new or existing variable.(defaults to `DT_FLOAT`).
> >   +
> > -    Returns:
> > -      initializer and initializing_from_value. See documentation of get_variable above.
> >   +
> > -    Raises:
> > -      TypeError: When giving unsupported dtype.
> > -    """
> > -    if dtype.is_floating:
> > -      initializer = init_ops.uniform_unit_scaling_initializer()
> > -      initializing_from_value = False
> > -    elif dtype.is_string:
> 
> I think tf.string is the same issue regarding initialization, so put them
> in one PR. If you insist that they are different, I can split them to
> reopen a PR for tf.string
>
